meanings: (눈으로) see, watch, look (at), catch sight (of); (처음으로) set[lay, clap] eyes (on); (목격하다) spot, witness
[접속사] than (※형용사, 부사의 비교급 뒤에 온다) [전치사] to (※prefer, be superior, be inferior 등의 뒤에 온다) 기타

meanings.meaning: in the present state of affairs

examples.korean: On the surface, he appeared unchanged. 발음듣기 외견상으로 봐서는 그는 달라지지 않은 것 같았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: On the surface, he appeared unchanged. 발음

examples.korean: ‘Are you going to come?’ ‘Perhaps. I’ll see how I feel.’ 발음듣기 “너 올 거니?” “어쩌면. 기분 봐서.” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘Are you going to come?’ ‘Perhaps. I’ll see how I feel.’ 발음

examples.korean: He’s a ruthless businessman, as I know to my cost. 발음듣기 그는 인정사정없는 사업가예요. 내가 직접 당해 봐서 알아요. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He’s a ruthless businessman, as I know to my cost. 발음

examples.korean: ‘Are you going to the beach tomorrow?’ ‘It depends on the weather.’ 발음듣기 “내일 해변에 갈 거니?” “날씨에 달렸지[날씨 봐서].” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘Are you going to the beach tomorrow?’ ‘It depends on the weather.’ 발음

examples.korean: Not Spain again! Been there, done that, got the T-shirt. 발음듣기 또 스페인은 싫어요! 거긴 이미 가 봐서 다 알고 거기 티셔츠도 하나 샀는걸요. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Not Spain again! Been there, done that, got the T-shirt. 발음
